result.execSummary:
The defendant Owen W Masters was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Jail for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.
If probation or extended supervision is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Defendant shall obtain/maintain full-time employment and or school.

Defendant shall have no contact with Chad G., his residences or his businesses, Donald C., Riverhorse West or Collin's Deck Bar.  
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Defendant shall not associate with known drug dealers or users.
Defendant shall not be present in any place where controlled substances are illegally purchased, sold or consumed.

Defendant shall maintain a stable residence.
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant shall notify all healthcare providers of addiction history.
Defendant shall notify Agent within 48 hours of being prescribed medications.
Defendant shall submit to random drug screens including blood, breath or urine.
Defendant shall take medications as prescribed.

timeConds.notes:
Commencing forthwith.  Time shall be served with Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.
Per order of the Court on 1-30-17, transfer is authorized to a jail convenient to Defendant's employment or residence, specifically Waukesha County.

superMiscConds.notes:
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol.  

Defendant shall not associate with known drug users or be present where drugs are illegally purchased, sold or consumed. 

Defendant shall not enter any establishments whose primary purose is the sale or serving of alchohol. 

Defendant shall have no contact with Riverhorse West located in West Bend WI.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent, including an AODA assessment and shall follow through with all treatment recommendations. 

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety. 

Defendant shall submit to random drug screens of his blood, breath or urine. 

Defendant shall repay the remaining financial obligations previously imposed.  lf extended supervision is revoked and the defendant will have a mandatory release from prison, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
